examples: He's usually in a good mood — the operative word there being "usually". Today was a disaster.

definitions.definition: Having the power of acting; hence, exerting force, physical or moral; active in the production of effects.
Producing the appropriate or designed effect; efficacious.
examples: an operative dose, rule, or penalty

definitions.definition: Based upon, or consisting of, a surgical operation or operations.

secondary_definitions: Having the power of acting; hence, exerting force, physical or moral; active in the production of effects.
Producing the appropriate or designed effect; efficacious.
Based upon, or consisting of, a surgical operation or operations. [from 18th c.]
